course_title: Population Oral Health and Professional Practice II

learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the patients' rights, and complaints' mechanisms.
Demonstrate how to communicate responsibly and professionally when using media.
Demonstrate the importance of practising with personal and professional integrity, honesty and trustworthiness.
Analyse and make judgements on scenarios which involve patients' consent, confidentiality and autonomy.
Understand and apply the policies of the regulatory bodies that govern the provision of oral health services in Australia.
Critically apply the ethical principles and legal responsibilities underpinning the provision of dental care.

assessments.task_description:
Quiz 1 of 2 based on the readings and workshops of the topics 1-6 . You will have 20 min to complete 10 questions at the end of the workshop. The quiz will be strictly completed in class.

Quiz 2 of 2 based on the readings and workshops of of the topics 1-10. You will have 20 min to complete 10 questions at the end of the workshop. The quiz will be strictly completed in class.

assessments.due_date:
10/10/2025 5:00 pm

Penalty will apply for late submission
assessments.task_description:
TASK DESCRIPTION:

In this assessment, you are to produce a video that demonstrates a reflection of your experience at the Oral Health Centre clinics. Your reflection can be based on any clinical experience that you have observed that demonstrated good professional practice or has resulted in your perspective or informed your future practice. You will need to describe the experience, analyse the experience and reflect on how it has informed your future practice.

The reflective process has the potential to enable the beginning health practitioner to learn from their professional experiences, to link theory and practice gaps, and to describe and understand their own feelings and influence, in clinical practice.

Through reflection on your clinical exposure, the purposes of this assessment task are:

  • recognise the focus on the patient’s best interests and providing patient-centred care and respect patients’ dignity;
  • observe and describe communication and engagement with patients, patient’s families and communities in relation to oral health;
  • observe and understand the importance of communication and intra and inter-professional approaches to health care.

FORMAT:

The final submission is to be a video journal of your reflections. The length of the video should be between 3 to 5 minutes and it should demonstrate the ability to reflect on your observations.

The expectations of the type of video are very broad and while you are encouraged to be creative with the presentation of your reflection, there are no marks awarded for presentation.

assessments.due_date:
31/10/2025 5:00 pm

Penalty will apply for late submission
assessments.task_description:
STRUCTURED REFLECTION TASK

TASK DESCRIPTION

This course focuses on the application of ethical, legal and professional considerations that are to be applied in clinical scenarios. To facilitate the analysis of these considerations, you are provided with a clinical stimulus that you should explore and then answer the structured reflection questions. 

SUBMISSION

Submission is through a TurnItIn link available through Blackboard. Ensure that your reflection is submitted as a PDF with no identifying indicators as there is a peer marking task associated with your reflection.

FORMAT

This is a reflective writing task and your response to each question should be labelled clearly.

assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
A 1-hour exam consisting of different question types including but not limited to multiple choice, short answer questions, short essays and problem-solving covering content from Week 1 to Week 13 (inclusive).

This is a MUST PASS assessment item (achieve a minimum of 50% to pass). Supplementary assessment is available for this item (in accordance with PPL Assessment Procedure Section 3 Part J).

learning_activities.topic:
Dentistry in Australia

A description of the profession of dentistry within Australia and defining professionalism.

Learning outcomes: L03, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Dentistry in Australia A description of the profession of dentistry within Australia and defining professionalism.

learning_activities.topic:
What is bioethics?

The ethical principles involved with dentistry and how they help inform professional practice.

Learning outcomes: L03, L04, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: What is bioethics? The ethical principles involved with dentistry and how they help inform professional practice.

learning_activities.topic:
Regulation, AHPRA and Dental Board

An introduction to the legal system and laws that impact dentistry. Accessing and understanding regulations.

Learning outcomes: L01, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Regulation, AHPRA and Dental Board An introduction to the legal system and laws that impact dentistry. Accessing and understanding regulations.

learning_activities.topic:
Negligence, deception and conflict of interest

Legal framework for negligence and compensation under Australian laws and risk management principles. Explores paternalistic and non-paternalistic deception.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Negligence, deception and conflict of interest Legal framework for negligence and compensation under Australian laws and risk management principles. Explores paternalistic and non-paternalistic deception.

learning_activities.topic:
Autonomy, consent and confidentiality

Exploring the key concepts of autonomy, consent and confidentiality including ethical and legal considerations.

Learning outcomes: L03, L04, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Autonomy, consent and confidentiality Exploring the key concepts of autonomy, consent and confidentiality including ethical and legal considerations.

learning_activities.topic:
Ethical issues in practice

Scope of practice, standard of care, duty to treat and terminating a patient/dentist relationship.

Learning outcomes: L01, L05, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Ethical issues in practice Scope of practice, standard of care, duty to treat and terminating a patient/dentist relationship.

learning_activities.topic:
Quality control

Evaluation of quality control: self and others. Mandatory reporting and whistle blowing.

Learning outcomes: L05, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Quality control Evaluation of quality control: self and others. Mandatory reporting and whistle blowing.

learning_activities.topic:
Dentistry as a business

Business ethics versus professional ethics.

Learning outcomes: L03, L04, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Dentistry as a business Business ethics versus professional ethics.

learning_activities.topic:
Expanded scope of practice

Evidence-based practice: ethics of differences in opinion versus differences in science.

Learning outcomes: L04, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Expanded scope of practice Evidence-based practice: ethics of differences in opinion versus differences in science.
